actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Called up by House Under Suspension of Rules.
Resolution Agreed to in House by Yea-Nay Vote: 403 - 0 (Record Vote No: 189).
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

official_title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress concerning the human rights situation in North Korea and the reduction of tensions on the Korean peninsula.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that the Government of North Korea should: (1) cease its attempts to subvert the Republic of Korea and agree to measures that will reduce tensions on the Korean peninsula; (2) take steps to reduce its international isolation by considering the cross recognition of the two Korean governments by other countries and dual membership in the United Nations; and (3) cease human and political rights abuses.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress concerning the human rights situation in North Korea and the reduction of tensions on the Korean peninsula.
